definitions.definition: past simple of the verb may, used especially when reporting what someone has said, thought, asked, etc.:
examples: I brought him some sandwiches because I thought he might be hungry.

definitions.definition: used to express the possibility that something will happen or be done, or that something is true although not very likely:
examples: I might come and visit you next year, if I can save enough money.
Pizarro defeated the might of the Inca Empire with only a few hundred men.
